title: 11 London Coffee Shops Named Best in the UK for 2026
summary: The Best Coffee Shops UK list for 2026 includes twelve London entries out of 44 nationwide, a quarter of the total. Prufrock, Catalyst, Scenery, Carbon Kopi, Formative, Saint Nine, Nostos, Curators, Moonstruck, Zero to One, Specialty Cafetiere, and Calico all made the cut. Shops were judged on nine criteria including coffee quality, barista expertise, and community engagement. All are now in contention for the World's 100 Best Coffee Shops 2026.
statement: Twelve London shops named among UK's 44 best for 2026.

brands_mentioned.name: Prufrock Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Gwilym Davies won the 2009 title before founding Prufrock with Jeremy Challender inside Present menswear boutique on Shoreditch High Street. They moved to a former XXX bookstore on Leather Lane in 2011. Fifty sanded bookcases from the previous tenant line the 2,000-square-foot interior alongside pink columns. The name comes from T.S. Eliot: "I have measured out my life with coffee spoons."

Square Mile Coffee Roasters acquired a 75% stake in 2017. Guest roasters rotate through Tim Wendelboe, La Cabra, Coffee Collective, and Drop Coffee. A Victoria Arduino Black Eagle designed with James Hoffmann runs alongside V60, Chemex, AeroPress, and syphon. Jeremy Challender won the 2016 UK Brewers Cup.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Gwilym Davies, Jeremy Challender, Klaus Kunke

brands_mentioned.name: Catalyst
brands_mentioned.story:
Alex Gkikas soft-launched in late 2016, officially opening in January 2017 at a corner of Grays Inn Road and Baldwin's Gardens. He started with Swedish roaster Koppi's beans before the 12kg Diedrich became operational. Single-origins only: four Ethiopian coffees typically rotate, with direct trade lots from Finca La Lomita in Colombia and Taiwanese Geisha producers.

Birch, cork, and copper set the Scandinavian-inspired interior, where Jars ceramics serve the coffee. Greek-influenced brunch runs until 3pm, with plate-sized pancakes that won Best Breakfast 2020. Thursday and Friday evenings bring cocktails alongside chalkstream trout ceviche and grilled chicken hearts with dashi broth.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Approximately 12 coffees available: one espresso blend for retail only, multiple single-origins for shop service. Sugar cane decaf from Colombia. Origins predominantly Central and South America plus Africa. Switched from omni-roast principle to separate filter and espresso roasts based on customer feedback.

brands_mentioned.name: Scenery Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Stu, Ross, and Alex opened inside a former Victorian schoolroom at the Jerwood Space on Union Street in Southwark. A Loring S35 roasts very light, with coffees categorised by roaster influence rather than traditional roast colour. Artist Lucas Garcia creates custom illustrations for each release, earning a Sprudgie Award nomination for Design/Packaging alongside a Notable Roaster nod in 2024.

A Poursteady autobrew offers six to seven rotating coffees alongside a Mavam undercounter espresso system. The former classroom retains period features with 100% upcycled furniture and a glasshouse filled with tropical plants. An electric van runs London deliveries in reusable containers, with jute coffee sacks recycled into insulation.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Loring S35 roaster producing very light roasts compared to typical UK market standards. Categorizes coffee by roaster influence from lightest to heavy rather than traditional roast colors. Sources seasonally and works upstream with suppliers, pre-contracting at harvest six months ahead. Purchases coffee early while still in origin country and releases coffees as they arrive in the UK to align with seasonal availability. Focuses on coffees offering higher value for producers and progressive processing methods.

brands_mentioned.name: Carbon Kopi
brands_mentioned.story:
Natalie and Chris met and fell in love with coffee in Auckland before relocating to London. They opened the first Carbon Kopi on Margravine Road in Hammersmith in October 2019, in a space that was a cafe fifty years ago and most recently a family funeral parlor. A second followed on Hazlebury Road in Fulham in May 2022, housing the first Victoria Arduino Black Eagle Maverick installed in the UK.

Square Mile supplies the house roast, with monthly guest rotations from Plot, Prolog, Round Hill, and Mame. Estate Dairy provides unhomogenised milk, and cold brew uses single-origin Peruvian beans.

brands_mentioned.name: Formative Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
The title came in a blind knockout: national champions brew five espressos each, judged without knowing who made them. Kissick also won the 2023 UK Barista Championship and placed sixth at the 2024 Worlds in Busan. Head roaster Nicholas Pastellopoulos is a Q grader and SCA Authorized Trainer, and barista Haruka Nango won the 2024 UK Latte Art Championship.

From Magherafelt in Northern Ireland, Kissick discovered specialty coffee at Workshop in Fitzrovia before opening on Butler Place in March 2019. Projects Office designed the 80-square-metre flatiron corner: a curved black bar echoes the building's shape, bespoke terrazzo counters sit on black terrazzo floors, and an orange ceiling is the sole colour accent.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Nicholas Pastellopoulos serves as head roaster and Q Arabica grader, handling green buying and roast development. The program categorizes coffees as Benchmark, Exceptional, Competition, Future, or Decaf. Guest roasters including La Cabra feature alongside house roasts.

brands_mentioned.name: Saint Nine Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Canadian Laith Wael Toukan opened in August 2020 on a wedge-shaped site near Tate Modern. OAOA Architecture designed the 38 square metre interior around curved matte black walls.

Gabe Sapienza's mural spans the ceiling in pink and purple sunset mountains above a village scene, lit by neon orange LED strips along the wall edges. Assembly, Round Hill, North Star, and Bailies rotate through the bar.
brands_mentioned.description: Compact Bankside specialty coffee shop on Southwark Street with minimalist black interior and a signature mural by artist Gabe Sapienza.

The shop features a distinctive interior designed by OAOA Architecture with a statement mural by artist Gabe Sapienza, creating a minimalist aesthetic with curved matte black walls in a compact 38 square meter space.

brands_mentioned.name: Curators Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Catherine Seay defined the service standards at Kaffeine on Great Titchfield Street from 2009 to 2011. She opened Curators Coffee Studio in March 2012 on pedestrianized Cullum Street near Leadenhall Market. A custom teal-plated La Marzocco Strada three-group runs house espresso alongside guest roasters, with three colour-coordinated Mahlkönig grinders.

SEND Coffee, a nonprofit training young adults with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities, now operates the shop. The compact corner space has dark wood tables under tall windows, with covered outdoor seating in the adjacent passageway.

brands_mentioned.name: Moonstruck Cafe
brands_mentioned.story:
Alexa Lee won the title and represented the UK at Worlds in Chicago, having placed fifth at the 2023 UK Barista Championship. Owner Liam Clifford, a Rosslyn Coffee alumnus, opened Moonstruck on South Lambeth Road in February 2024. Plot roastery in Woolwich supplies the house espresso, a Kenyan from Muthuaini washing station, alongside eleven pour-over options and guests including SEY, Standout, and Aoma from Japan.

YAM Studios designed the interior with an Antwerp aesthetic: cane bench seating with olive cushions, Akari-style paper lantern lamps, and a dark graphic-print carpet. A Sticker Room adds a creative twist, and the basement houses Under The Spell, an artistic venue.

brands_mentioned.name: Zero to One Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Pham Mai Linh and Tran Thi Minh Phuc roast Vietnamese beans in-house in small batches, sourced directly from farms in Lam Dong province. Fine Robusta from GOT Farm undergoes anaerobic natural processing at 800-1000 metres, and each cup arrives on a stainless steel tray with a tasting card detailing origin, varietal, and altitude.

A team member took first place at the 2025 English AeroPress Championship and second at the CAFEC Brewers Cup. Custom mineralized water is blended for each brew method. The compact Widegate Street shop has light wood surfaces, bar seating at the window, and serves ca phe sua alongside espresso and batch filter.

brands_mentioned.name: Specialty Cafetiere
brands_mentioned.story:
Paolo Giovinazzo, who owns Caffè Cannizzaro in southern Italy and has twenty years of roasting experience, started the business with cousin Mauro Laruffa after he moved to London in 2015. All coffee roasts on demand for retail and wholesale, with a manual lever machine pulling shots at the bar.

Victoria Arduino and Mahlkönig round out the equipment range.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Twenty years of roasting experience from founder Paolo Giovinazzo. Five single origins and a half-caff blend, roasted to order for retail and wholesale.

facts.claim: Specialty Cafetiere was founded by Paolo Giovinazzo, a coffee roaster with 20 years of experience and owner of Caffè Cannizzaro coffee company in southern Italy, and his cousin Mauro Laruffa, who moved to London in 2015.

Specialty Cafetiere is an independent Hackney roastery and cafe that roasts all its own specialty coffee on demand for retail and wholesale, operating as both a coffee shop and equipment retailer/service provider.
The business operates as an equipment retailer and service provider, selling and servicing La Marzocco espresso machines, Victoria Arduino equipment, and Mahlkönig grinders.

brands_mentioned.name: Calico Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Two Chinese entrepreneurs opened on Lower Marsh in Waterloo in December 2024. Owner Junchao's architectural background shapes the interior: a dark wood U-shaped counter with cube-like overhead lighting beneath a wood slat feature wall with granite counter tops.

A La Marzocco Strada runs the brew bar alongside pour-over. The retail shelf stocks Panama Geisha from Esmeralda and El Burro Estate, Yunnan Geisha from China, and Kenya Maguta single origins. Brass wall sconces and fresh flower arrangements in pink and orange complete the space.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: They package roasted coffee in translucent sienna bags sold in-shop and online. The house espresso blend sources from Kenya, Yunnan (China), and Brazil, while specialty lots include Panama Geshas and anaerobic naturals from the Candela Highlands.

brands_mentioned.name: Special Guests Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Paul Ross won the UK title in 2019 with a natural Geisha from Panama's Auromar farm, then retained it in 2020 using Kiss the Hippo coffee. After years as their Wholesale Manager, he launched Special Guests online in 2022 and opened on Aybrook Street in late 2024.

Two stainless steel counters run the length of the room: one for a white Slayer espresso machine and Mahlkönig grinders, the other a dedicated V60 pour-over station serving 12 single-origin filters. A frozen archive preserves past lots for revisiting.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Paul Ross (2x UK Barista Champion) selects and roasts all coffees. Features guest roasters from Europe on rotation. Collaborates with Auromar farm in Panama for Geisha coffees. Partners with The Coffeevine for GEMS limited-edition releases.

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Prufrock Coffee
brand.story:
Gwilym Davies won the 2009 title before founding Prufrock with Jeremy Challender inside Present menswear boutique on Shoreditch High Street. They moved to a former XXX bookstore on Leather Lane in 2011. Fifty sanded bookcases from the previous tenant line the 2,000-square-foot interior alongside pink columns. The name comes from T.S. Eliot: "I have measured out my life with coffee spoons."

Square Mile Coffee Roasters acquired a 75% stake in 2017. Guest roasters rotate through Tim Wendelboe, La Cabra, Coffee Collective, and Drop Coffee. A Victoria Arduino Black Eagle designed with James Hoffmann runs alongside V60, Chemex, AeroPress, and syphon. Jeremy Challender won the 2016 UK Brewers Cup.

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Catalyst
brand.story:
Alex Gkikas soft-launched in late 2016, officially opening in January 2017 at a corner of Grays Inn Road and Baldwin's Gardens. He started with Swedish roaster Koppi's beans before the 12kg Diedrich became operational. Single-origins only: four Ethiopian coffees typically rotate, with direct trade lots from Finca La Lomita in Colombia and Taiwanese Geisha producers.

Birch, cork, and copper set the Scandinavian-inspired interior, where Jars ceramics serve the coffee. Greek-influenced brunch runs until 3pm, with plate-sized pancakes that won Best Breakfast 2020. Thursday and Friday evenings bring cocktails alongside chalkstream trout ceviche and grilled chicken hearts with dashi broth.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Approximately 12 coffees available: one espresso blend for retail only, multiple single-origins for shop service. Sugar cane decaf from Colombia. Origins predominantly Central and South America plus Africa. Switched from omni-roast principle to separate filter and espresso roasts based on customer feedback.

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Scenery Coffee
brand.story:
Stu, Ross, and Alex opened inside a former Victorian schoolroom at the Jerwood Space on Union Street in Southwark. A Loring S35 roasts very light, with coffees categorised by roaster influence rather than traditional roast colour. Artist Lucas Garcia creates custom illustrations for each release, earning a Sprudgie Award nomination for Design/Packaging alongside a Notable Roaster nod in 2024.

A Poursteady autobrew offers six to seven rotating coffees alongside a Mavam undercounter espresso system. The former classroom retains period features with 100% upcycled furniture and a glasshouse filled with tropical plants. An electric van runs London deliveries in reusable containers, with jute coffee sacks recycled into insulation.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Loring S35 roaster producing very light roasts compared to typical UK market standards. Categorizes coffee by roaster influence from lightest to heavy rather than traditional roast colors. Sources seasonally and works upstream with suppliers, pre-contracting at harvest six months ahead. Purchases coffee early while still in origin country and releases coffees as they arrive in the UK to align with seasonal availability. Focuses on coffees offering higher value for producers and progressive processing methods.

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Carbon Kopi
brand.story:
Natalie and Chris met and fell in love with coffee in Auckland before relocating to London. They opened the first Carbon Kopi on Margravine Road in Hammersmith in October 2019, in a space that was a cafe fifty years ago and most recently a family funeral parlor. A second followed on Hazlebury Road in Fulham in May 2022, housing the first Victoria Arduino Black Eagle Maverick installed in the UK.

Square Mile supplies the house roast, with monthly guest rotations from Plot, Prolog, Round Hill, and Mame. Estate Dairy provides unhomogenised milk, and cold brew uses single-origin Peruvian beans.

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Formative Coffee
brand.story:
The title came in a blind knockout: national champions brew five espressos each, judged without knowing who made them. Kissick also won the 2023 UK Barista Championship and placed sixth at the 2024 Worlds in Busan. Head roaster Nicholas Pastellopoulos is a Q grader and SCA Authorized Trainer, and barista Haruka Nango won the 2024 UK Latte Art Championship.

From Magherafelt in Northern Ireland, Kissick discovered specialty coffee at Workshop in Fitzrovia before opening on Butler Place in March 2019. Projects Office designed the 80-square-metre flatiron corner: a curved black bar echoes the building's shape, bespoke terrazzo counters sit on black terrazzo floors, and an orange ceiling is the sole colour accent.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Nicholas Pastellopoulos serves as head roaster and Q Arabica grader, handling green buying and roast development. The program categorizes coffees as Benchmark, Exceptional, Competition, Future, or Decaf. Guest roasters including La Cabra feature alongside house roasts.

location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Saint Nine Coffee
brand.story:
Canadian Laith Wael Toukan opened in August 2020 on a wedge-shaped site near Tate Modern. OAOA Architecture designed the 38 square metre interior around curved matte black walls.

Gabe Sapienza's mural spans the ceiling in pink and purple sunset mountains above a village scene, lit by neon orange LED strips along the wall edges. Assembly, Round Hill, North Star, and Bailies rotate through the bar.
brand.description: Compact Bankside specialty coffee shop on Southwark Street with minimalist black interior and a signature mural by artist Gabe Sapienza.

facts.claim: Saint Nine Coffee was founded in August 2020 by Laith Wael Toukan, a Canadian national who currently resides in the United Kingdom.
Saint Nine is a multi-roaster specialty coffee shop emphasizing hospitality and care, featuring rotating selections from UK specialty roasters including Assembly, Round Hill, North Star, and Bailies.

The shop features a distinctive interior designed by OAOA Architecture with a statement mural by artist Gabe Sapienza, creating a minimalist aesthetic with curved matte black walls in a compact 38 square meter space.

location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Curators Coffee
brand.story:
Catherine Seay defined the service standards at Kaffeine on Great Titchfield Street from 2009 to 2011. She opened Curators Coffee Studio in March 2012 on pedestrianized Cullum Street near Leadenhall Market. A custom teal-plated La Marzocco Strada three-group runs house espresso alongside guest roasters, with three colour-coordinated Mahlkönig grinders.

SEND Coffee, a nonprofit training young adults with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities, now operates the shop. The compact corner space has dark wood tables under tall windows, with covered outdoor seating in the adjacent passageway.

espresso: La Marzocco Strada (3-group, custom teal plating)

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Moonstruck Cafe
brand.story:
Alexa Lee won the title and represented the UK at Worlds in Chicago, having placed fifth at the 2023 UK Barista Championship. Owner Liam Clifford, a Rosslyn Coffee alumnus, opened Moonstruck on South Lambeth Road in February 2024. Plot roastery in Woolwich supplies the house espresso, a Kenyan from Muthuaini washing station, alongside eleven pour-over options and guests including SEY, Standout, and Aoma from Japan.

YAM Studios designed the interior with an Antwerp aesthetic: cane bench seating with olive cushions, Akari-style paper lantern lamps, and a dark graphic-print carpet. A Sticker Room adds a creative twist, and the basement houses Under The Spell, an artistic venue.

brand.name: Zero to One Coffee
brand.story:
Pham Mai Linh and Tran Thi Minh Phuc roast Vietnamese beans in-house in small batches, sourced directly from farms in Lam Dong province. Fine Robusta from GOT Farm undergoes anaerobic natural processing at 800-1000 metres, and each cup arrives on a stainless steel tray with a tasting card detailing origin, varietal, and altitude.

A team member took first place at the 2025 English AeroPress Championship and second at the CAFEC Brewers Cup. Custom mineralized water is blended for each brew method. The compact Widegate Street shop has light wood surfaces, bar seating at the window, and serves ca phe sua alongside espresso and batch filter.

brand.name: Specialty Cafetiere
brand.story:
Paolo Giovinazzo, who owns Caffè Cannizzaro in southern Italy and has twenty years of roasting experience, started the business with cousin Mauro Laruffa after he moved to London in 2015. All coffee roasts on demand for retail and wholesale, with a manual lever machine pulling shots at the bar.

Victoria Arduino and Mahlkönig round out the equipment range.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Twenty years of roasting experience from founder Paolo Giovinazzo. Five single origins and a half-caff blend, roasted to order for retail and wholesale.

location.name: London
location.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

brand.name: Calico Coffee
brand.story:
Two Chinese entrepreneurs opened on Lower Marsh in Waterloo in December 2024. Owner Junchao's architectural background shapes the interior: a dark wood U-shaped counter with cube-like overhead lighting beneath a wood slat feature wall with granite counter tops.

A La Marzocco Strada runs the brew bar alongside pour-over. The retail shelf stocks Panama Geisha from Esmeralda and El Burro Estate, Yunnan Geisha from China, and Kenya Maguta single origins. Brass wall sconces and fresh flower arrangements in pink and orange complete the space.
brand.ownRoastDesc: They package roasted coffee in translucent sienna bags sold in-shop and online. The house espresso blend sources from Kenya, Yunnan (China), and Brazil, while specialty lots include Panama Geshas and anaerobic naturals from the Candela Highlands.

brand.name: Special Guests Coffee
brand.story:
Paul Ross won the UK title in 2019 with a natural Geisha from Panama's Auromar farm, then retained it in 2020 using Kiss the Hippo coffee. After years as their Wholesale Manager, he launched Special Guests online in 2022 and opened on Aybrook Street in late 2024.

Two stainless steel counters run the length of the room: one for a white Slayer espresso machine and Mahlkönig grinders, the other a dedicated V60 pour-over station serving 12 single-origin filters. A frozen archive preserves past lots for revisiting.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Paul Ross (2x UK Barista Champion) selects and roasts all coffees. Features guest roasters from Europe on rotation. Collaborates with Auromar farm in Panama for Geisha coffees. Partners with The Coffeevine for GEMS limited-edition releases.

title: London Coffee Festival Awards 2025 Winners
summary: Hermanos Colombian Coffee Roasters took Best Independent Coffee Shop for its Portobello Road location and Best Multiple Operator (10-50 sites). Fuckoffee Bermondsey won Best Café Design, Bija took Best New Coffee Shop, and Carnival Coffee Roasters won Best Community Coffee Shop. Black Sheep Coffee was named Best Multiple Operator (50+ sites).
statement: Hermanos wins two awards at 2025 London Coffee Festival.

brands_mentioned.name: Hermanos Colombian Coffee Roasters
brands_mentioned.story:
Victor and Santiago Gamboa started with a pop-up in Walthamstow in 2018 and grew to ten locations across London in six years with no external investors. Every bean comes from Colombia through direct trade. Named farmer partnerships include Rolando Bonilla in Norte de Santander, Sergio Aranda in Huila, the Torres family in Santander, and Santiago Salazar's carbon-neutral Hacienda El Calapo.

At London Coffee Festival 2025 they won both Best Independent Coffee Shop and Best Coffee Shop Operator. The lineup runs eleven coffees including Liliana's Gesha, available at Selfridges and featured in Vogue and Forbes.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Victor Gamboa, Santiago Gamboa, and Adnan Millwala
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Direct trade with Colombian farms. Sources include Don Rolando from Brisas del Táchira in Norte de Santander, Doña Delfina and Don Daniel from Acevedo in Huila, Maria Torres from Curiti in Santander, and organic Hacienda El Calapo from a carbon neutral farm in Santander.

brands_mentioned.name: Fuckoffee
brands_mentioned.story: The vintage drum roaster works from Somerset, producing organic fairtrade beans from PNG's highlands since 1999. The Brick Lane original started as an internet cafe and now anchors four London shops. All packaging is 100% compostable, and the brand supports the Free West Papua campaign.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Vintage 1960s Probat roaster named Greta in Somerset. Single origin Arabica organic fairtrade from Papua New Guinea highlands for almost 20 years. Tasting notes of spicy Mexican chocolate, honey, ginger, cedar.

brands_mentioned.name: Bija Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Former BBC World Service journalist Devi Trianna opened Bija at St James's Market in November 2024, six months before winning Best New Coffee Shop of the Year at the 2025 London Coffee Festival. The name means seed in Indonesian, and the logo draws from Batik Kawung, an ancient Javanese pattern.

All beans are Indonesian: Sumatra Lintong, Mandheling, Old Brown Java, and Kerinci, sourced through Kindred Forest with a rainforest preservation focus. Kerinci lots come from women-managed processing. Alongside espresso and filter, Bija serves kopi tubruk, a traditional unfiltered method, and Ice Arenga with organic palm sugar. Terracotta walls, rattan chairs, and a woven textile with geometric patterns line the interior.

brands_mentioned.name: Carnival Coffee Roasters
brands_mentioned.story:
Juan Cely grew up on a coffee farm near Medellin where his grandfather has cultivated beans since winning the mountain in a card game. A cup in Chiapas during a family backpacking trip through Central America convinced Juan and his wife Jayne to quit their jobs and start roasting. They began in a garden workshop on a Besca in 2019 and opened the Penge shop in October 2023.

A Loring Falcon15, shipped from California after an eighteen-month wait, now handles the roasting. Juan and Ryohji won the 2023 Extracted Development Competition at Manchester Coffee Festival. Cycle courier Richard covers 200 miles a week across southeast London, and local illustrator Rosie Lovelock draws carnival-mask labels for each origin.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Juan Cely and Jayne Cely Cromwell
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Loring Falcon15 air roaster cuts energy use by 80% through single-burner design and hot air recirculation. Roasts from inside-out rather than outside-in, producing lighter-appearing beans. Small-batch model in South Norwood facility near the Clock Tower. Direct trade sourcing includes family farm in Colombia. Roasted 10 tonnes across 45 different coffees in 2023. Top sellers: San Ramon (Nicaragua), Sidamo (Ethiopia), La Virgen (Colombia). All packaging features carnival-inspired mask designs by local illustrator Rosie Lovelock.

title: Build-Outs of Coffee: Scenery in London
summary: Scenery Coffee roasts light on a Loring S35 from its Union Street café, attached to the Jerwood Space performing arts complex. A Mavam undercounter espresso machine and Poursteady autobrew system serve six to seven rotating filter coffees. All furniture is upcycled, and artist Lucas Garcia creates custom illustrations for each coffee. Scenery won Best Design/Packaging at the 16th Annual Sprudgie Awards.
statement: Sprudge profiles Scenery Coffee's on-site roastery on Union Street.

brands_mentioned.name: Scenery Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Stu, Ross, and Alex opened inside a former Victorian schoolroom at the Jerwood Space on Union Street in Southwark. A Loring S35 roasts very light, with coffees categorised by roaster influence rather than traditional roast colour. Artist Lucas Garcia creates custom illustrations for each release, earning a Sprudgie Award nomination for Design/Packaging alongside a Notable Roaster nod in 2024.

A Poursteady autobrew offers six to seven rotating coffees alongside a Mavam undercounter espresso system. The former classroom retains period features with 100% upcycled furniture and a glasshouse filled with tropical plants. An electric van runs London deliveries in reusable containers, with jute coffee sacks recycled into insulation.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Loring S35 roaster producing very light roasts compared to typical UK market standards. Categorizes coffee by roaster influence from lightest to heavy rather than traditional roast colors. Sources seasonally and works upstream with suppliers, pre-contracting at harvest six months ahead. Purchases coffee early while still in origin country and releases coffees as they arrive in the UK to align with seasonal availability. Focuses on coffees offering higher value for producers and progressive processing methods.

title: WatchHouse Raises $14.8 Million Series B with Eyes on US Expansion
summary: WatchHouse closed a $14.8 million Series B round in December 2025, led by HighPost Capital, the private equity firm co-founded by Mark Bezos. HighPost contributed £7.3 million of the total. The funding will support expansion beyond its 22 UK locations and two New York cafés, with a third Manhattan site planned. WatchHouse also acquired five former Orée Boulangerie locations in London earlier in 2025.
statement: WatchHouse closes $14.8 million Series B led by HighPost Capital.

brands_mentioned.name: WatchHouse
brands_mentioned.story:
Roland Horne traded his luxury aquarium consultancy for coffee, opening the first inside an octagonal 1810 guard house on Bermondsey Street in 2014. They took the Independent title at the 2023 European Coffee Symposium in Barcelona, then the Chain award a year later. Locations now reach London, Bath, the Chrysler Building in New York, and Abu Dhabi.

A refurbished 1959 Probat UG22 from Bonanza in Berlin anchors the Maltby Street roastery. Head roaster Nikol Novotna, a Q Arabica Grader and SCA Sensory Judge, sources from Ethiopia's Bensa highlands, China's Dongka farm in Yunnan, and Brazil's Mio Fazenda. Deidra Hodgson, formerly of Aesop, leads the interiors programme.
brands_mentioned.description: Cosy, unique coffee spots & eateries in London. We make great coffee and exceptional food within beautifully bespoke environments tailored around our local community. It is as simple as that. | Never worry about running out of coffee supplies again. The Modern Coffee experience from the comfort of your own home.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Specialty coffee roaster with dedicated Coffee Labs in South London and New York. Offers three coffee lines: Rituals (everyday), Ventures (adventurous), and Horizons (expressive/unusual). Sources globally with focus on provenance and quality.

title: Kenyan Roaster Spring Valley Opens First International Café in Islington
summary: Spring Valley Coffee Roasters, established in Nairobi in 2009 with nine cafés across Kenya, chose Islington's Camden Passage for its first international location. The shop runs a La Marzocco Strada with a Swan grinder, serving beans roasted at origin in Nairobi. Spring Valley traces its roots to one of Kenya's first coffee estates, planted in 1905 on the outskirts of the capital.
statement: Nairobi's Spring Valley Coffee opens first UK shop on Camden Passage.

brands_mentioned.name: Spring Valley Coffee Roasters
brands_mentioned.story:
Ritesh Doshi, a former investment banker who had been a regular customer, acquired the roastery in 2018 and transformed it into Africa's first B Corp-certified coffee company, scoring 83.8. All beans are hand-roasted in small batches at the original Nairobi roastery in the Spring Valley neighbourhood, where one of Kenya's first coffee estates was planted in 1905.

The London shop on Camden Passage is their first location outside Kenya, joining eight Nairobi cafes. They pay farmers 25-30% above market rate through forward contracts. Inside the 1909 building, exposed red brick was chosen to echo Kenyan soil, wood to mirror the coffee trees, and metal to reference processing tools. Framed photographs of Kenyan coffee harvests line the walls, and African artists' work rotates through the space. All espresso is served as doubles, with batch brew and pour over roasted separately.

title: WatchHouse Acquires Five Orée Boulangerie Sites in London
summary: After Orée Boulangeries entered administration in April 2025, WatchHouse took over five of its London locations: Covent Garden, Borough Market, Parsons Green, St John's Wood, and Clapham. The sites will be rebranded as WatchHouse outlets over twelve months, adding to the chain's existing 19 London shops. WatchHouse also operates two New York cafés and has seven further UK sites in development.

title: The Barn Berlin Opens First London Café on Charlotte Street
summary: The Barn, the Berlin-based specialty roaster with cafés in Germany and Mallorca, opened at 36 Charlotte Street in Fitzrovia. The shop features exposed-brick walls, an L-shaped brew bar, and a single-origin-only programme with espresso flights and pour-overs. It joins a growing wave of European roasters establishing London outposts.
statement: Berlin roaster The Barn opens its first London shop in Fitzrovia.

brands_mentioned.name: The Barn London
brands_mentioned.story:
A brunch spot on Holloway Road near Emirates Stadium. Reclaimed wood plank flooring in varying tones runs beneath exposed brick walls and a timber frame ceiling. Black track lighting and ceiling fans hang overhead.

An L-shaped counter with oak cladding and dark stone top holds a V60 station and Comandante grinder. Wooden block benches line the walls, with black metal stools at the bar.

title: Nagare Coffee Opens Flagship at Triptych Bankside
summary: Co-founder Dora Lau opened Nagare's third London location at Triptych Bankside in March 2025, the largest of its three shops. The flagship joins the original Spitalfields café and a Soho site near Carnaby Street that opened in December 2024. Nagare serves single-origin hand-filtered coffee alongside Asian baked goods and homeware.
statement: Nagare opens 1,782 sq ft flagship at Triptych Bankside.

brands_mentioned.name: Nagare
brands_mentioned.story:
Co-founder Dora Lau named Nagare after the Japanese word for flow, a philosophy drawn from Bruce Lee's "Be water, my friend." The first opened opposite Spitalfields Market in January 2023, followed by Carnaby and a 1,700-square-foot flagship at Triptych Bankside.

Guest roasters rotate from Market Lane in Melbourne, Weekenders in Kyoto, and Sweven in Bristol. Filter coffees arrive with tasting cards, ordered from clipboards rather than a wall menu. The Pearl 40, a signature of jasmine pearl tea, espresso, and crushed pistachio, sits alongside yuzu cruffins and miso caramel shortbread.

title: European Coffee Trip Awards 2025 - Istanbul Winners
summary: Over 22,000 votes across 4,300 specialty cafés determined the country winners. Meet Lab Coffee in Moda took Turkey's top spot, with antre, Coffee Department, Blum Coffee, Spada Coffee, and VAA Coffee also placing in the Turkish top ten. The awards, now in their fourth year, are voted through the European Coffee Trip mobile app.
statement: Meet Lab Coffee named Turkey's best café in the 2025 European Coffee Trip Awards.

brands_mentioned.name: Meet Lab Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
The in-house roastery rotates single origins from Rwanda, Panama, and Ethiopia, with fermented processing a recurring focus. V60 and batch brew sit alongside espresso, cold brew, and nitro. Signatures include the Cherry Cherry Lady flatwhite and Japanese iced coffee from Rwandan Muhondo beans.

They produce their own Final Touch water kit and craft eco-friendly Korean-style ceramics for service. The Suadiye branch won a 2025 European Coffee Trip award.
brands_mentioned.description: Nitelikli Kahve Dükkanı. Meet Lab Coffee ( Best Coffee Formula ) | Filtre Kahve Çeşitleri,  Kahve Makinası, Kahve Çeşitleri ve kahveye dair her şey.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: In-house roastery rotating through 3-4 origins including Rwanda, Panama, and Ethiopia, known for fermented processing methods

brands_mentioned.name: Coffee Department
brands_mentioned.story:
Metin Benbasat founded Coffee Department in 2014 and opened the Balat cafe in May 2015, five minutes from the Greek Patriarchate near the Golden Horn. The 1.5kg Probat Probatino sits visible in the centre. Brazil Pedro Azul anchors the house espresso, with Ethiopia Kochere, Ethiopia Shawo natural, and Colombia Aromas Del Sur rotating alongside Chemex and V60 filter.

Benbasat, listed in the Coffee Quality Institute database, bakes wheat-free cakes and brownies himself. A second location in Nişantaşı and wholesale supply to cafes like Gravité followed.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Probatino roaster producing eight coffees from Costa Rica, Colombia, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Brazil, and Peru. Honey and experimental processes alongside washed lots.

brands_mentioned.name: Spada Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Cumhur Kılıç named the brand after the Italian word for sword, matching his Turkish surname. He opened the first shop in Teşvikiye in 2016 and started roasting a year later.

A 2024 facility designed by Espas Mimarlık handles 40 tonnes monthly on a Genio 60kg roaster, with a cupping room and training lab running La Marzocco Strada EP and Mahlkönig grinders. Around 50 wholesale accounts run alongside the retail locations.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: 40 tonnes monthly production at Istanbul facility. Small-batch roasting with attention to origin characteristics. Vertical integration from sustainable sourcing through retail.

brand.name: Meet Lab Coffee
brand.story:
The in-house roastery rotates single origins from Rwanda, Panama, and Ethiopia, with fermented processing a recurring focus. V60 and batch brew sit alongside espresso, cold brew, and nitro. Signatures include the Cherry Cherry Lady flatwhite and Japanese iced coffee from Rwandan Muhondo beans.

They produce their own Final Touch water kit and craft eco-friendly Korean-style ceramics for service. The Suadiye branch won a 2025 European Coffee Trip award.

title: Istanbul Coffee Festival 2025 - 11th Edition in Kadikoy
summary: Over 200 domestic and international brands exhibited at Tepe Nautilus from 11-14 September, with free tastings of 100+ bean varieties. Thude Robotics debuted X Barista, an AI-powered coffee station billed as a fourth-generation brewing experience. Festival founder Alper Sesli highlighted discussions around domestic Turkish coffee cultivation alongside the country's five-century consumption tradition.
statement: Istanbul Coffee Festival returned for its 11th year across 10,000 sqm in Kadikoy.

title: World of Coffee Asia Heading to Bangkok in 2026
summary: The Specialty Coffee Association confirmed Bangkok's BITEC as the venue for World of Coffee Asia 2026, running 7-9 May. The event follows previous editions in Busan and Jakarta, and will feature the Asian national coffee championships. SCA chief Yannis Apostolopoulos cited Thailand's growing specialty scene as a factor in the selection.
statement: Bangkok will host the third World of Coffee Asia in May 2026.

title: Thailand Coffee Fest 2025 Draws 100,000 to Bangkok
summary: Thailand Coffee Fest ran 10-13 July at IMPACT Muang Thong Thani with over 200 exhibitors and free entry. The anniversary edition featured the Thai Specialty Coffee Awards 2025, live barista championships, and an international coffee pavilion. Equipment brands La Marzocco, Slayer, and Timemore showcased alongside Thai roasters.
statement: Southeast Asia's largest coffee festival returned for its 10th anniversary in Bangkok.

title: Chatchalerm Lertanekwattana Becomes First Thai World Coffee Champion
summary: Chatchalerm Lertanekwattana, competing for Roots, became the first Thai competitor to win any World Coffee Championship discipline. Known as Boss, he took the Cup Tasters title at World of Coffee Geneva. The result marks a milestone for Thailand's specialty coffee industry after years of growing international competition presence.
statement: Thailand's first World Coffee Championship win came at the 2025 Cup Tasters in Geneva.

brands_mentioned.name: Roots
brands_mentioned.story:
Chatchalerm Lertanekwattana won the 2025 World Cup Tasters title in Geneva, Thailand's first victory at any World Coffee Championship. Founder Varatt Vichit-Vadakan, the 2014 Thailand Barista Champion, launched Roots in 2013 with head roaster Korn Sanguenkeaw and experience specialist Somdej Luengtaviboon.

The roastery works exclusively with Thai beans from eight farming families across Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai, Tak, and Mae Hong Son. A cup-to-farm programme returns revenue to origin communities. Single origins include Sanchai, Pangkhon Village, Aten from Mae Daet Noi, and Chang Pao from Le Tor Glo. The House Blend combines 65% Pangkhon Black Honey with Mae Suay and Kenya-washed Pangkhon lots.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Varatt Vichit-Vadakan (Tae), Korn Sanguenkeaw, and Somdej Luengtaviboon
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Boutique micro roastery. Works with 8 coffee families across 7 regions in 3 Thai provinces (Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai). Roasting philosophy: sweet, balanced profiles preserving origin characteristics. Produces single-origins (Sanchai and Pangkhon Village) and blends (Aftersweet Blend and Classic Kids Blend).

title: The Sprudge Guide to Coffee in Bangkok
summary: Benjamin Sand's updated guide spans the entire city, from Samadool and Moon Phases in residential neighbourhoods to Ceresia, Blackhills, and Nana Roasters closer to the centre. All cafes from the original guide remain open. The piece credits the past decade's growth to Thai roasters working directly with highland farmers in Chiang Rai and Chiang Mai.
statement: Sprudge published its second Bangkok guide, a decade after the first.

brands_mentioned.name: Samadool Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Jessada, Pornwichai, Chanon, Priyawadee, and Pornpat returned from Sydney roasting jobs to open in Thonglor's back streets at Soi Sukhumvit 49/1. Samadool means 'Balance' in Thai. Tucked away enough to require real effort to find, the roaster sits at the rear of the building with beans visible in baskets awaiting distribution.

Green beans arrive through Melbourne Coffee Merchants and Caravela Coffee. Ethiopian, Colombian, and Bolivian lots rotate alongside Northern Thai single origins. They wholesale to a network they call the Samadool Family: Bora Bora Cafe, 7 Rabbit, Shades of Retro, and Black Winter among them.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Jessada Itthithanakorn, Pornwichai C., Chanon N., Priyawadee Amornurathkul, Pornpat S.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Direct sourcing from both Thailand and abroad, bypassing traditional Thai suppliers to access unique beans. Lighter roast profiles with floral, fruity characteristics. Wholesale supplier to multiple Bangkok coffee shops.

brands_mentioned.name: Ceresia
brands_mentioned.story:
Sisters Marian and Lucia Aguilar grew up on their family's Santa Lucia coffee farm in Venezuela. Both trained at Monmouth Coffee in London before co-founding Ceresia with Lucia's husband Bret Asavaroengchai, a Thai-American, in 2013. The name means cherry in Latin, a nod to the coffee cherry fruit.

Their brother recommends origins across Latin America: Chanjul Estate in Mexico, Fazenda Río Verde in Brazil, Inzá in Colombia. Kenyan Kianjuki AA and a Ceresia Thai Blend round out the range, all small-batch roasted weekly by Bret at the back of the Sukhumvit Soi 41 shop.

brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Small-batch roasting, rotating up to 6 single-origins weekly. Sources from Thailand, Latin America, Africa, Asia through direct farm relationships.

Black Honey Thailand (malt, chocolate, mangosteen). Rubyiniro Hill Mbilima Rwanda (orange citrusy, caramel, spices; 160฿). Familia Gomez Colombia (chocolate, toffee caramel, strawberry; 150฿). Mae Toey Thailand (lemon, honey, jasmine tea; 160฿). San Antonio México (mango, fresh pineapple, floral, candy mouthfeel; 140฿). Drinks: Espresso, Piccolo, Hot/Iced Latte 140฿, Flat White 140฿, Cappuccino 140฿, Dirty, Hot/Iced Americano 130฿, Long Black 6oz 130฿; Café Au Lait 8oz filter with milk. Bangkok. Bret handles all sourcing and roasting himself with the roaster visible at the back of the store. The couple have intentionally wanted to create an environment where people can learn about the coffee and engage with the process and be a marked contrast to the instagram-focused outlets that have become recently popular in Bangkok.

brands_mentioned.name: Kurasu
brands_mentioned.story:
Yozo Otsuki quit Goldman Sachs Tokyo and started Kurasu in Sydney in 2013. Both his parents ran jazz kissaten in Kyoto: his father a typical jazz kissa, his mother a gallery-kissa combination. The first café opened in 2016 next to Kyoto Station; the roastery moved to a renovated machiya in Nishijin in 2021.

A Loring S35 Kestrel and Giesen W6A roast microlots from named producers including Carmelo Yujra in Bolivia, Primavera Coffee in Guatemala, and Java Frinsa Estate in Indonesia. A subscription since 2015 partners with Japanese roasters like Light Up Coffee, Trunk, and Glitch.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Kyoto roastery sourcing from Colombia, Ecuador, Ethiopia, Guatemala, Honduras, Kenya and Thailand. Light and medium roasts across single origins and blends; roasted at Nishijin on a Loring 35kg. Beans shipped to all global locations.

brands_mentioned.name: Gallery Drip Coffee
brands_mentioned.story: Piyachat Trithaworn earned the nickname Drip King after photographing an Arabica plantation inspired him to brew. He and Natthiti Ampriwan opened Gallery Drip Coffee as an art project, decorating with coffee-inspired artwork throughout. Thai single origins from Mae Jan Tai, Baan Wat Chan, and Pang Khon sit alongside Kenyan imports, all brewed by hand with no espresso machine in sight.

brands_mentioned.name: Brave Roasters
brands_mentioned.story:
Ekameth 'Tay' Wipvasutti studied music at Mahidol University before training under Happy Espresso's owner in Chiang Mai. He started roasting in 2013, frustrated by the dark roasts available locally, and won the World Aeropress Championship in Melbourne exactly a decade later. Two Thailand Brewers Cup titles followed in 2017 and 2024.

Thailand's first coffee soft serve arrived in 2016, its first concentrate in 2017. The Flag Bearer blend splits between PaPae and JomThong beans from Northern Thailand, supported by a Micro-Lot Reserve program pairing directly with farming families.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Operates an Official Roastery HQ established in 2018. Specializes in rotating limited-edition releases, northern Thai blends, and an extensive international line-up of beans including single origins, blends, and competition-grade beans.

brands_mentioned.name: Greydient & Them
brands_mentioned.story:
Raj and Keynes founded Greydient Lab in Singapore in 2020 before expanding to Bangkok. Their collaboration with Them.X Coffee from Samut Prakan opened on Ratchadaphisek Road during Bangkok Design Week on 27 January 2024.

Four house blends rotate: Them Blend from Ethiopian Yirgacheffe, Greydient Blend pairing Thailand Mae Jan Tai with Brazilian Mantiqueira de Minas, and a Tiramisu Blend using Honduras whisky barrel-aged beans. Raw concrete, stainless steel furniture, and monochrome tones fill the two-storey loft, with rotating art installations and creative workshops.
brands_mentioned.description: A hidden gem in Asoke, Greydient & Them is a collaboration between Singaporean design studio Greydient Lab and Samut Prakan roaster Them.x Coffee. The loft-style space offers a quiet escape with industrial-chic decor, serving specialty coffee and creative signature drinks.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Uses beans from their partner 'Them.x Coffee', featuring house blends like 'Them Blend' (Ethiopia), 'Greydient Blend' (Brazil + Thai), and 'Tiramisu Blend'.

facts.claim: Greydient & Them is a collaboration between Greydient Lab (a Singapore design studio) and Them.X Coffee (a cafe from Samut Prakan, Thailand).
Greydient Lab was founded in 2020 by Raj and Keynes with a mission to create a positive impact through design.
The cafe opened during Bangkok Design Week on 27 January 2024.
Greydient Lab is headquartered in Bangkok and was founded in Singapore, with expansion across Asia Pacific including Thailand, Korea, and the Philippines.
Them.X Coffee's original location is in Samut Prakan at 71 Sukhumvit Soi 25, Pak Nam, operating from 09:00-17:00.
The cafe is located at 6/25 Ratchadaphisek Road, Khlong Toei, Bangkok 10110, approximately 200 meters from BTS Asoke Station exit 4.
The cafe operates Monday-Friday 7:00 AM-5:00 PM and Saturday-Sunday 8:00 AM-5:00 PM.
Them Blend is composed of Ethiopia Yirgacheffe with flavor notes of floral, brown sugar, and stone fruit.
Greydient Blend combines Brazil Minas and Thailand Maejantai with flavor notes of chocolate, nutty, and creamy.
Tiramisu Blend features Honduras whisky barrel-aged beans with flavor notes of rum raisin, tiramisu, chocolate, and vanilla.
His Blend uses Brazil Minas beans with flavor notes of dark chocolate and full body.
Single-origin offerings include Colombia Muricio Dugue and decaffeinated options.
The cafe serves specialty coffee from global and local roasters with beans that change seasonally.
Menu includes alternative versions of their blends: Them Blend (Brazil + Rwanda) and Greydient Blend (Thailand + Brazil + Uganda).

Signature drinks include Bandung Breeze (rose syrup with milk, topped with jasmin cream), Som Som (real orange juice topped with Biscoff biscuits), and Bandung Blitz (rose syrup with milk, jasmin cream, and coffee).
Special drinks include Peanut Butter Cocoa, Craft Cola (homemade cola), Coffee Cola, Es-Press-Som (homemade citrus syrup and coffee), Yuzu Coffee, Cold Brew Lychee, Matcha Coconut, and Latte Coconut.
Menu includes non-coffee beverages such as matcha, houjicha, and craft chocolate drinks.
Food offerings include chocolate cookies with sugar coating.
The interior features a loft-style design with industrial aesthetics including raw concrete, stainless steel furniture, and monochrome tones.
The cafe has two floors with seating on both levels, and an outdoor seating area on the ground floor.
Design elements include black tones throughout, stainless steel furniture, loft-style wall decorations on the second floor, and decorative posters lining the staircase walls.
The cafe interior looked like a warehouse with captivating industrial design.
A smoking area is available at the entrance.
The space provides a quiet atmosphere with background music, primarily attracting foreign clientele.
Once inside, the hustle and bustle of nearby Asok junction fades entirely, offering peaceful and chill vibes.
The design and build services were credited to Greydient Lab.
The venue is dog-friendly, welcoming dogs indoors.
The cafe offers free parking but spaces are difficult to locate.
Delivery service is available for the nearby Sukhumvit 23 area.
The cafe serves dine-in, takeaway, and on-site services.
Price range is 100-200 Thai Baht.
The cafe features rotating art installations and hosts creative workshops.
Contact phone numbers are 061-393-9146 and 093-459-8963.

brands_mentioned.name: Phil Coffee Company
brands_mentioned.story:
Han Wang abandoned his degree after stumbling into a coffee roastery in Taiwan. He trained there, then brought a roaster and beans to Bangkok in 2011, launching Phil Coffee from a small Bangna shop with sisters Jaszmine and Iwuen. The name combines their initials and the Greek word for love.

Han placed 1st runner-up at the 2018 Thailand Roasting Championship. Weekly small-batch roasting produces house blend Urso, chocolatey and nutty, and filter blend Hummingbird from Brazilian and Ethiopian beans. Seasonal blends mix Chiang Rai lots with African or Brazilian origins.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Han Wang, Iwuen Wang, and Jaszmine Wang
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Dedicated Bangna roasting facility. Small-batch roasting with weekly cycles. Scandinavian-influenced light to medium profiles. 75% wholesale distribution. First runner-up Thailand National Roasting Championship 2018.

brands_mentioned.name: Pacamara
brands_mentioned.story:
Chartree Treelerkul earned the certification in 2001 while running Zana's Bean Coffee, a Chiang Mai roastery popular with tourists. He remains Thailand's only SCAA Lead Instructor. Pacamara launched in 2009 under Peaberry Limited, and a GMP-certified plant staffed by Q-graders now supplies all branches.

Beans arrive from eleven countries, including Thai lots from Mae Chan and Doi Chang, Ethiopian Gedeb, Kenyan Murang'a, Panamanian Geisha from Finca Auromar, and Yemeni lots. The House Blend won the 2012 International Coffee Tasting Award in Italy. Slayer machines and Kalita Wave brewers run the bars.

brands_mentioned.name: Kaizen Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Founded in 2015 by three friends including Arnun Wattanaporn, who studied hospitality at MNM Institute in Sydney and worked at The Grounds of Alexandria. Named after the Japanese philosophy of continuous improvement, Kaizen brewed specialty coffee before it became mainstream in Bangkok.

A multi-roaster format carries competition-grade single origins from Ethiopia, Kenya, and Indonesia. Sample Coffee Roasters from Sydney supplies the Sukhumvit 49 outpost. Five S Blend and New Horizons Blend headline alongside nitro cold brew.

brands_mentioned.name: Factory Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Bew-Setthakan Weerakultaewan placed second at the 2022 World Espresso Championship after winning Thailand's Barista Championship three times. In 2025, a team member finished in the top three at the World Coffee Roasting Championship.

The roastery works with Sirinya Coffee Farm in Chiang Rai, where Bourbon, Caturra, and Catimor varietals grow at 1,300 to 1,500 metres. Bold profiles include black honey, yellow cherry, and pink bourbon processes. The signature Moscow arrives in a skull-shaped glass.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: In-house roasting with championship-level expertise. Founder has Top 3 World Roasting Championship placement. Complete control from sourcing to final roast.

brands_mentioned.name: Smokey Cat Coffee Roaster
brands_mentioned.story:
Roasted small batches for a year before opening the corner unit in June 2021. Blue Magic delivers blueberry notes, Norah's Blend pairs Ethiopia Yirgacheffe with orange and chocolate, and Baken Blend combines Brazil Cerrado and Ethiopian beans for dark chocolate and caramel. Single origins rotate, including a Costa Rica Santa Teresa lot processed with yellow honey. A Mahlkönig handles pour-over and espresso.

Floor-to-ceiling windows light the teal corrugated metal bar counter. Vinyl records line the shelves, and customers can bring their own to play.
brands_mentioned.description: Specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Sathorn serving a range of espresso drinks, slow bar filter coffee, creative beverages such as creme brulee latte and craft cola, plus bagels and bakery goods in a relaxed corner setting. Baristas are friendly and whole beans and blends are available for purchase.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Small-batch carefully selected beans. Roasted for a year before opening. House blends include Blue Magic (blueberry notes) and Honduras Litchilian (caramel-vanilla undertones).

brands_mentioned.name: SINGLE LANE Specialty Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Teerawat Buranaprasopchai and Maytika Panjaroen spent four years as baristas in Australia before opening on Sukhumvit 69, the narrow shopfront inspiring both the name and their single-origin focus. Filter beans rotate from Coffee Collective, Market Lane, Colonna, and Gringo Nordic, with house espresso from Pobnar. Pastries come from Australian bakery Conkey's.

A small row of wooden tables sits tightly together on brick flooring, with a few seats out front among the plants. Sprudge described them as having 'huge influence in the Bangkok specialty scene'.
brands_mentioned.description: A cozy, Australian-inspired specialty coffee shop and roastery in Phra Khanong. The 'Single Lane' name reflects its focus on single-origin beans, its deep, one-lane shophouse architecture, and the founders' singular passion for coffee.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: In-house roasting of high-quality single-origin beans

brands_mentioned.name: Roots
brands_mentioned.story:
Chatchalerm Lertanekwattana won the 2025 World Cup Tasters title in Geneva, Thailand's first victory at any World Coffee Championship. Founder Varatt Vichit-Vadakan, the 2014 Thailand Barista Champion, launched Roots in 2013 with head roaster Korn Sanguenkeaw and experience specialist Somdej Luengtaviboon.

The roastery works exclusively with Thai beans from eight farming families across Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai, Tak, and Mae Hong Son. A cup-to-farm programme returns revenue to origin communities. Single origins include Sanchai, Pangkhon Village, Aten from Mae Daet Noi, and Chang Pao from Le Tor Glo. The House Blend combines 65% Pangkhon Black Honey with Mae Suay and Kenya-washed Pangkhon lots.
brands_mentioned.Founder: Varatt Vichit-Vadakan (Tae), Korn Sanguenkeaw, and Somdej Luengtaviboon
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Boutique micro roastery. Works with 8 coffee families across 7 regions in 3 Thai provinces (Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai). Roasting philosophy: sweet, balanced profiles preserving origin characteristics. Produces single-origins (Sanchai and Pangkhon Village) and blends (Aftersweet Blend and Classic Kids Blend).

title: Thailand Coffee Hub 2025 at Central Chiang Mai
summary: Thailand Coffee Hub 2025 occupied Central Chiang Mai from 2-6 April, billed as the country's largest coffee festival. The event brought roasters, equipment suppliers, and baristas to northern Thailand's specialty coffee heartland, where most of the country's arabica is grown across Chiang Rai and Chiang Mai provinces.
statement: Thailand's biggest coffee festival ran five days at Central Chiang Mai in April.

title: Build-Outs: Roc & Rye in Manchester
summary: The venue occupies a 1920s Alfred Waterhouse building at 60 Spring Gardens with art deco interiors. Espresso comes from Origin Coffee Roasters, with plans for premium filter offerings including rare varietals. The dual concept serves specialty coffee by day and cocktails by night.
statement: Roc & Rye opened a craft coffee and cocktail bar inside a Grade II listed Manchester building.

brands_mentioned.name: Origin
brands_mentioned.story:
Tom Sobey founded Origin in Cornwall in 2004, after his father's time as a Bewley's franchisee and his own stint working coffee on Australia's Gold Coast. The Porthleven roastery now runs two Loring Smart roasters, producing over a tonne daily with 80% less fuel than conventional machines.

Head of Coffee Freda Yuan won the UK Cup Tasters Championship in 2017, 2018, and 2020, placing third at the World Cup Tasters in 2017. B Corp certified and a Queen's Award recipient for Sustainable Development, Origin also won Europe's Best Speciality Coffee Roaster at the Allegra Awards.
brands_mentioned.description: Discover speciality coffee at our flagship Shoreditch coffee shop in East London. Find address, opening times and directions here.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Origin roasts at their headquarters in Porthleven, Cornwall. They started with a Diedrich IR12 roaster in 2008 and have grown to become one of Europe's most recognised specialty roasters. Monthly rotating feature coffees are curated from their origin partners.

awards.award: UK Cup Tasting Champion (3x - Freda Yuan)

title: Manchester Food & Drink Festival Awards 2025 - Coffee Nominees
summary: The MFDF Awards nominated Oscillate Coffee, Sipp Coffee, Just Between Friends Coffee, Federal Cafe Bar, and four others in the Cafe/Coffee Shop of the Year category. Public voting ran through January 2026, with winners crowned at New Century on 26 January. The awards marked their 25th year with 128 total nominees across 16 categories.

title: Bangkok's Best New Cafes of 2025
summary: The guide highlights a wave of specialty openings across Bangkok, with Song Wat emerging as a cafe district housing 20+ new spots. Featured newcomers include Dak Coffee Roasters, Craftsman Roastery, Piccolo Vicolo, Sauce Coffee, Rise Coffee, Kurasu Thonglor, and World Wide Arabica. Many occupy converted heritage buildings with minimalist interiors.
statement: Time Out Bangkok picked 28 new cafes defining the city's 2025 coffee scene.

brands_mentioned.name: Dak Coffee Roasters
brands_mentioned.story: Canadians Louis-Philippe Boucher and Veronique Lagarde founded the roastery in Amsterdam after relocating from Montreal via Italy and the UK. Boucher left venture capital work in 2019, completed a week-long roasting course in Berlin, then launched with Lagarde handling marketing. They roast on Probat equipment and operate wholesale-focused distribution across UK, Ireland, Poland, Czech Republic, and Slovakia.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Probat roaster producing light profiles from Colombia and Ethiopia. Sources include Finca El Paraiso and Daye Bensa, across washed, natural, and anaerobic processes.
brands_mentioned.statement: Amsterdam roastery by two Canadians, wholesale across five European countries.

brands_mentioned.name: Craftsman Roastery
brands_mentioned.story:
Roasts in-house at the Old Town flagship, a 127-year-old Bumrungnukulkit Printing House from the reign of King Rama V. The Baan Ajarn Farang branch occupies Bhirasri's former home, the Italian-born sculptor who became Thailand's Father of Modern Art.

Seven blends draw from Chiang Rai, Ethiopia, Colombia, Costa Rica, and Laos. The lemongrass latte blends Artisan Blend with lemongrass and star anise.

brands_mentioned.name: Piccolo Vicolo
brands_mentioned.story:
Exposed concrete pillars and bare brick from the original 1970s structure frame both floors. Green glass fishing-float pendants hang above a dark steel bar topped with a mint green La Marzocco, while trailing pothos plants cascade from metal planters. Upstairs, reclaimed wood flooring and mid-century leather lounge chairs face corrugated polycarbonate panels.

Signature drinks include Black Coconut, Black Lemon, and Vanilla Bean Cloudy Latte, all made with homemade syrups. Handmade ceramic stoneware is used for dine-in service.

brands_mentioned.name: SAUCE COFFEE
brands_mentioned.story:
A parking lot turned creative hub on Sukhumvit 24, near Emporium. OWT Blend uses Thai beans from Khun Lao Village for cacao, caramel, and raisin notes. A+E Blend splits between Lisu Estate and Ethiopian Yirgacheffe for lemon candy and black tea. Thai ingredients run through the menu: tea from Chiang Mai, cacao from Chanthaburi, honey from Chiang Mai.

A compact take-away kiosk in wood and dark green with a terrazzo-patterned counter. Small seating area on wooden chairs. Recognised among Bangkok's best new cafés of 2025.

brands_mentioned.name: RISE COFFEE
brands_mentioned.story:
Kasidis Laoboonmee started roasting beans in his home garage in 2016, selling small wholesale orders to neighbourhood cafes. He quit his full-time job in 2019 and spent a year traveling to origins and working free shifts at roasteries before founding RISE COFFEE in 2020.

The RISE LAB micro-roasting programme works directly with northern Thai farming cooperatives, sharing feedback to improve green bean quality. Seasonal single origins rotate through espresso and filter. Orange Wafer Latte, topped with lemon crumble and orange sauce, and Black Fizz, cold brew with specialty cola and lychee purée, are the signatures.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Single-origin coffees from Brazil, Costa Rica, Ethiopia, Kenya and house blends, natural and washed processing, varietals including 74112 and SL28, available as whole beans, cold brew, capsules, drip bags.

brands_mentioned.name: Kurasu
brands_mentioned.story:
Yozo Otsuki quit Goldman Sachs Tokyo and started Kurasu in Sydney in 2013. Both his parents ran jazz kissaten in Kyoto: his father a typical jazz kissa, his mother a gallery-kissa combination. The first café opened in 2016 next to Kyoto Station; the roastery moved to a renovated machiya in Nishijin in 2021.

A Loring S35 Kestrel and Giesen W6A roast microlots from named producers including Carmelo Yujra in Bolivia, Primavera Coffee in Guatemala, and Java Frinsa Estate in Indonesia. A subscription since 2015 partners with Japanese roasters like Light Up Coffee, Trunk, and Glitch.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Kyoto roastery sourcing from Colombia, Ecuador, Ethiopia, Guatemala, Honduras, Kenya and Thailand. Light and medium roasts across single origins and blends; roasted at Nishijin on a Loring 35kg. Beans shipped to all global locations.

facts.claim: Founded by Yozo Otsuki in May 2013 as an online store while based in Sydney, Australia, after quitting his job at Goldman Sachs Tokyo
Kurasu means 'lifestyle' in Japanese
Both of Otsuki's parents ran their own separate jazz kissaten in Kyoto - his father ran a typical jazz kissa while his mother ran an artistic gallery and kissa combination
Originally launched as an online store selling Japanese homeware and craftsmanship, but coffee equipment resonated most strongly with customers

Opened Bangkok location in August 2019 at Bambini Villa on Soi Sukhumvit 26
Ultimate aim is to spread Japanese coffee culture globally and the beauty of community built around it
Deliberately avoids spectacle and hype, drawing inspiration from Kyoto's multi-generational family businesses operating sustainably without flashy marketing
Training emphasizes omotenashi (Japanese hospitality) - intuitive, humble service. Sends Japanese team members to new locations and facilitates trips to Kyoto
Otsuki stated he has no exit plan, viewing Kurasu as a lifetime commitment potentially passing to future generations
Rooted in jazz kissaten culture from the 1970s - drinking coffee accompanied by carefully selected jazz music handpicked by the owner

brands_mentioned.name: Morgen Coffee
brands_mentioned.story:
Off Soi Sukhumvit 39 in Phrom Phong. PORTS Coffee, roasted in a heritage building in Tha Tien, pulls smooth Brazilian Arabica through espresso. Exposed raw concrete ceiling with steel beams meets white subway tile and a plywood-clad bar with stainless steel trim.

Vintage hi-fi speakers sit on open shelving above the counter. Window seating overlooks greenery, and matte grey cups keep the palette muted.

title: Manchester Coffee Festival 2025
summary: The 2025 edition at Bowlers Exhibition Centre in Trafford Park ran 14-16 November with a new Friday industry session and the UK Filter Championships. Over 50 roasters exhibited, with Ugandan coffee making its first group appearance in the UK. The programme included workshops, live competitions, and DJ sets.
statement: Manchester Coffee Festival featured 50+ international roasters across three days in November.

locations_mentioned.name: Manchester
locations_mentioned.story: Manchester's industrial heritage meets modern coffee culture, with converted warehouses housing some of the North's finest roasters.

title: Best New Manchester Openings of 2025
summary: The 2025 roundup features new hospitality venues including Artista Perfetto and Sipp among coffee-focused openings. The guide covers spots across Stockport, Ramsbottom, Prestwich, Chorlton, MediaCity, and Salford, reflecting growth in specialty coffee and food beyond the city centre.
statement: Manchester's Finest picked the year's standout openings across Greater Manchester.

locations_mentioned.name: Manchester
locations_mentioned.story: Manchester's industrial heritage meets modern coffee culture, with converted warehouses housing some of the North's finest roasters.

title: 2025 SCASA National Coffee Champions Crowned in Cape Town
summary: The 2025 SCASA championships held 1 June in Cape Town crowned three national champions. Stevo Kuhn (Plato Coffee) won the Barista Competition for the third time and will compete at the World Barista Championship in Milan. Jeff Stopforth claimed his fifth consecutive Latte Art title. The Cup Tasters championship went to Brandon Madanha.
statement: Stevo Kuhn won his third South African barista title; Jeff Stopforth took a record fifth latte art crown.

title: Felix Ouma Wins Kenya National Barista Championship 2025
summary: Ouma won the Kenya National Barista Championship held 16-17 May at The Hub in Nairobi. Organised by Kenya Coffee Events under the Agriculture and Food Authority, the competition focused on sustainable and ethical coffee production. Ouma will compete at the 2025 World Barista Championship in Milan in October.
statement: Felix Ouma will represent Kenya at the World Barista Championship in Milan.

title: 10 Manchester Restaurant and Bar Closures That Shocked in 2025
summary: Feel Good Club in the Northern Quarter and Another Heart To Feed were among the closures driven by rising costs and staffing pressures. Almost Famous was rescued by the owners of PINS Social Club, while Sandinista closed after 13 years. The article notes that despite the losses, new openings continued to outpace closures across Greater Manchester.
statement: Manchester lost ten hospitality venues in 2025, though openings still outnumbered closures.

locations_mentioned.name: Manchester
locations_mentioned.story: Manchester's industrial heritage meets modern coffee culture, with converted warehouses housing some of the North's finest roasters.

title: Kenya's Domestic Coffee Consumption Redefining the Industry
summary: An SCA feature reports a 19% increase in Kenyan domestic coffee consumption from 2021/22 to 2022/23, driven by urbanisation and younger demographics. Nairobi leads the growth with specialty outlets including Artcaffe, Java House, and newer entrants like Kesh Kesh Coffee Roasters. Colonial-era policies that restricted local consumption are being reversed through education and value-addition programmes.
statement: Nairobi's coffee shops tripled from 231 to 791 between 2019 and 2023.

title: Coffee & Tea Fest Expo Uzbekistan 2025 in Tashkent
summary: The festival ran 16-18 May at Ankhor Lokomotiv Park with free admission. CIS championships included Barista Classic, Latte Art Battle, and Team Championship. Multiple zones covered installations, workshops, an art exhibition, Eastern bazaar, food court, and live concerts.
statement: The CIS region's largest coffee festival brought championships and 50+ exhibitors to Tashkent.

locations_mentioned.name: Tashkent
locations_mentioned.story: For a city of its size and stature, there is disappointingly little evidence of a speciality coffee scene. Bitterly disappointing for a city of over 2.5 million residents.

title: Inaugural Marrakech Coffee & Tea Festival Draws 30,000
summary: The inaugural Marrakech Coffee & Tea Festival ran 6-8 December at Mossalla Sidi Amara, organised by the Irfane Foundation. Over 400 exhibitors and 30,000 visitors attended. The programme included Morocco's first National Barista Championship judged to international standards, plus concerts, traditional ceremonies, and an art gallery.
statement: Marrakech launched Africa's largest coffee and tea festival with Rwanda as guest of honour.

locations_mentioned.name: Marrakesh
locations_mentioned.story: Marrakesh boasts Morocco's most developed speciality coffee scene, with a couple of high-quality establishments serving the city's considerable tourist population.

title: Bacha Coffee Opens at Marrakech Airport
summary: Founded in 1910, Bacha Coffee opened at Marrakech Menara Airport in December with over 200 arabica varieties on offer. The expansion aligns with Morocco's preparation for hosting the Africa Cup of Nations from 21 December. The brand combines local identity with a modern luxury concept.
statement: Luxury coffee brand Bacha Coffee launched at Marrakech Airport ahead of AFCON 2025.

locations_mentioned.name: Marrakesh
locations_mentioned.story: Marrakesh boasts Morocco's most developed speciality coffee scene, with a couple of high-quality establishments serving the city's considerable tourist population.

title: Cup of Excellence Thailand 2025
summary: The Alliance for Coffee Excellence brought its Cup of Excellence programme to Thailand in 2025, marking the first edition in the country. The competition evaluates Thai-grown specialty coffees through blind cupping by international judges, with winning lots sold at premium auction prices directly benefiting farming communities.
statement: Thailand hosted its Cup of Excellence competition for the first time in 2025.

title: Africa Coffee and Tea Expo 2025 Opens in Kigali
summary: The expo opened 8 July in Kigali with exhibitors from across East Africa. Activities included tea cupping, coffee evaluations, barista demonstrations, and B2B networking. The event aimed to connect African producers directly with international buyers and promote value addition within the continent.
statement: Rwanda hosted the Africa Coffee and Tea Expo to boost the continent's global market share.

title: Six Coffee + Wine Opens in Almaty
summary: Designed by local studio NAAW, Six Coffee + Wine operates as a cafe by day and wine bar by night. The playful interiors contrast minimalism with bold colour, setting what Wallpaper calls a new benchmark for hospitality design in Kazakhstan's largest city.
statement: Wallpaper featured Almaty's Six Coffee + Wine as a new standard for Kazakh hospitality design.

brands_mentioned.name: Six Coffee+Wine
brands_mentioned.story:
Co-founder Elvira Bakubayeva designed the concept around a shift from morning to evening: coffee by day, wine by night. NAAW Studio clad the walls in shell limestone from the same Kazakh quarries that dressed the Kazakhstan Hotel and Palace of the Republic.

Artist Zhanel Shakhan created custom stained glass panels, and wooden shutters control the light as the day progresses. Colour palettes shift from gentle yellows in the morning rooms to deeper hues in the wine bar.

locations_mentioned.name: Almaty
locations_mentioned.story: In a region starved of competition, Almaty comfortably takes the title of Central Asia's best coffee city. Expect an impressive selection of contemporary, well-designed shops scattered across the city, with particular concentration around Abay Avenue.

title: First International Coffee Fest Comes to Bishkek
summary: CoffeeFest Kyrgyzstan ran 22-23 November at the Kozhomkul Sports Palace. The first international-standard coffee festival in Bishkek featured ten lectures, masterclasses, tastings, and barista competitions run to international standards. Organisers attracted exhibitors from across Central Asia.
statement: Bishkek hosted Central Asia's largest coffee event with 47 exhibitors and 5,000 guests.

locations_mentioned.name: Bishkek
locations_mentioned.story: Frequently perceived to be ten years behind Almaty on the development curve, Bishkek's nascent speciality coffee scene confirms this assessment. Only a handful of options exist across the city.

title: Morocco Launches Africa's First Coffee Hub at Tanger Med
summary: The African Coffee Hub at the Tanger Med port complex enables direct purchasing from producers in Ethiopia, Kenya, Rwanda, and Tanzania. Coffee is processed on-site before export to Europe, the US, and Asia, keeping more of the value chain in Africa. Tanger Med is Africa's largest container port and ranks among the world's top 20.
statement: Morocco opened a pan-African coffee centre at Tanger Med to process and export African-grown beans.

locations_mentioned.name: Tangier
locations_mentioned.story: Like most Moroccan cities, contemporary coffee shops are scarce. Tangier, however, has one excellent option

title: Ben Rahim Opens Tunisia's First Specialty Coffee Shop
summary: Ben Rahim Coffee Company opened in February 2025 in the coastal suburb of Sidi Bou Said, becoming Tunisia's first dedicated specialty coffee experience. Founder Ben Rahim left Tunisia in 2008, operated a specialty shop in Germany, and returned to introduce the concept to a country rooted in Turkish cezve tradition. He also launched the annual Tunis Coffee Festival.
statement: Ben Rahim returned from Germany to open Tunisia's first specialty cafe in Sidi Bou Said.

brands_mentioned.name: Ben Rahim Coffee Company
brands_mentioned.story:
Wissem Ben Rahim worked at The Barn in Berlin before returning home to open in Sidi Bou Said in 2022. The shop runs a no-sugar, no-milk policy for hand-brewed coffee. Cezve pots are hand-hammered by Tunisian artisans in tin-lined copper with olive wood handles, each individually numbered with a lifetime warranty.

Equipment comes from Turgay Yildizli, three-time Turkish Cezve Champion and 2013 World Cezve/Ibrik Champion. The ibrik menu features Peruvian and Ethiopian beans including a Kochere lot with 48-hour fermentation. Free Sunday cuppings run at 2pm.
brands_mentioned.ownRoastDesc: Sources and roasts specialty beans with focus on rare Yemeni Yemenia variety and Arabian-influenced profiles. Fresh, seasonal offerings.

Berlin's Ben Rahim Is A Private Coffee Gateway

brands_mentioned.statement: Tunisia's first specialty coffee shop, founded the Tunis Coffee Festival.

locations_mentioned.name: Tunis
locations_mentioned.story: Whilst Tunisians have an insatiable appetite for coffee, generally served black in one of the nation's thousands of small, smoke-filled cafés, speciality coffee has failed to materialise in any meaningful capacity.

title: 9th Ankara Coffee Festival at Bilkent Center
summary: The festival ran 26-28 September at Bilkent Center with roasteries, international brands, workshops, seminars, and concerts. Programming bridged traditional Turkish coffee culture and modern specialty trends, with street food alongside cupping sessions. The event has become an annual fixture attracting thousands.
statement: Ankara held its ninth coffee festival celebrating both Turkish and specialty brewing traditions.

locations_mentioned.name: Ankara
locations_mentioned.story: Turkey's capital city balances government formality with a growing appreciation for artisanal coffee and modern café culture.

title: II Kazakhstan Coffee Festival 2025 in Almaty
summary: The two-day festival gathered coffee professionals and enthusiasts at the International Exhibition Center EXPO. Programming included barista competitions, professional consultations, equipment showcases, tastings, and a market. The event reflects growing specialty coffee interest in Central Asia's largest economy.
statement: Almaty hosted Kazakhstan's second national coffee festival at the EXPO centre.

locations_mentioned.name: Almaty
locations_mentioned.story: In a region starved of competition, Almaty comfortably takes the title of Central Asia's best coffee city. Expect an impressive selection of contemporary, well-designed shops scattered across the city, with particular concentration around Abay Avenue.

title: 9th Izmir Coffee Festival Features Three Turkish Champions
summary: The festival ran 10-12 October at Izmir Arena with 120+ brand booths and free workshops. Turkish champions Mehmet Emre Ozkaya (Latte Art), Gokhan Selamet (Brewing), and Koray Erdogan (Cezve/Ibrik) conducted demonstrations and training. Organised by SCA Turkey, the event offered free admission with tastings and live music.
statement: Izmir's ninth coffee festival brought Turkey's 2025 latte art, brewing, and cezve champions.

locations_mentioned.name: Izmir
locations_mentioned.story: This coastal city's relaxed Mediterranean atmosphere perfectly complements its emerging specialty coffee scene.
